definition: Compliance monitoring evaluates whether carrier actions meet statutory requirements, regulatory deadlines, and fair claims handling standards. State laws vary significantly, so analysis must be state-specific.

severityLevels.label: Likely Compliant
severityLevels.description: Carrier actions appear to meet statutory requirements and deadlines. No immediate compliance concerns.

severityLevels.label: Potential Concern
severityLevels.description: Some actions may not fully comply with requirements, or deadlines are approaching without clear resolution. Further investigation recommended.

severityLevels.label: Likely Violation
severityLevels.description: Carrier actions appear to violate statutory requirements, deadlines, or fair claims handling standards. Professional review strongly recommended.

scoringGuidelines: Always reference state-specific deadlines and requirements.
Compare actual carrier actions against statutory requirements.
Consider whether delays are reasonable given claim complexity.
Flag patterns of non-compliance, not isolated incidents.
Recommend professional review for serious concerns.
Note that state laws vary and interpretation may require legal expertise.
